content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
C# Comments
Comments can be used to explain C# code, and to make it more readable. It can also be used to 
prevent execution when testing alternative code.
Single-line Comments
Single-line comments start with two forward slashes (
//
).
Any text between
//
and the end of the line 
is ignored by C# (will not be executed).
This example uses a single-line comment before a line of code:
Example
// This is a comment
Console.WriteLine("Hello World!");

This example uses a single-line comment at the end of a line of code:
Example
Console.WriteLine("Hello World!");  // This is a comment

C# Multi-line Comments
Multi-line comments start with
/*
and ends with
*/
.
Any text between
/*
and
*/
will be ignored by C#.
This example uses a multi-line comment (a comment block) to explain the code:
Example
/* The code below will print the words Hello World
to the screen, and it is amazing */
Console.WriteLine("Hello World!");

Single or multi-line comments?
It is up to you which you want to use. Normally, we use
//
for short comments, and
/* */
for longer.
